name: Indian Penal Code (IPC)
summary: The main criminal code of India which covers all substantive aspects of criminal law. It defines crimes and prescribes punishments for them.
status: Replaced by Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita from July 1, 2024

name: Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS)
summary: New criminal code replacing IPC with modern provisions, gender neutrality, and inclusion of digital offences.

name: Indian Contract Act
summary: Governs contract law in India and is the key act regulating Indian contract law.
key_features: Defines essential elements of valid contract

name: Companies Act
summary: An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to companies in India.

name: Information Technology Act
summary: Primary law dealing with cybercrime and electronic commerce in India.

name: Transfer of Property Act
summary: Regulates the transfer of property in India, including sale, mortgage, lease, gift, and exchange.
scope: Applies to transfer of immovable property

name: Indian Evidence Act
summary: Contains set of rules and allied issues governing admissibility of evidence in Indian courts.
status: Replaced by Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam from July 1, 2024

name: Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam (BSA)
summary: New evidence law replacing Indian Evidence Act with focus on electronic evidence.

name: Hindu Marriage Act
summary: Governs marriage among Hindus including Buddhists, Jains, and Sikhs.
scope: Applies to Hindus, Buddhists, Jains, Sikhs

name: Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC)
summary: Main legislation on procedure for administration of substantive criminal law in India.
status: Replaced by Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita from July 1, 2024

name: Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS)
summary: Replaces CrPC with modern criminal procedure code focusing on time-bound justice.

name: Motor Vehicles Act
summary: An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to motor vehicles.

name: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act
summary: Provides protection to wives or female live-in partners from domestic violence.

name: Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act (POSH)
summary: Provides protection against sexual harassment of women at workplace.

name: Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act
summary: Laws relating to children alleged and found to be in conflict with law.

name: Consumer Protection Act
summary: Provides protection to consumers from unfair trade practices and establishes authorities for settlement of consumer disputes.
forums: District Commission, State Commission, National Commission

name: Copyright Act
summary: Governs the law relating to copyright in India.
key_features: Copyright protection for literary, artistic works

name: Trade Marks Act
summary: Governs the law relating to trademarks in India.
governing_body: Controller General of Patents, Designs & Trade Marks

name: Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act (NDPS)
summary: Consolidates and amends the law relating to narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances.

name: Negotiable Instruments Act
summary: Defines law relating to promissory notes, bills of exchange and cheques.

name: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act
summary: Prevents atrocities against members of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes.

name: Indian Forest Act
summary: Consolidates the law relating to forests, transit of forest-produce and duty leviable on timber.

name: Environment Protection Act
summary: Provides for the protection and improvement of environment and prevention of hazards to human beings, living creatures, plants and property.
key_features: Power to take measures to protect environment
governing_body: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change

name: Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act
summary: Replaces Persons with Disabilities Act, 1995 and provides for rights and entitlements of persons with disabilities.
reservation: 4% in government jobs, 5% in higher education

name: Hindu Succession Act
summary: Governs succession and inheritance laws for Hindus, Buddhists, Jains and Sikhs.
key_amendment_2005: Daughters get equal rights as sons

name: Muslim Personal Law (Shariat) Application Act
summary: Provides for application of Muslim Personal Law to Muslims in India in matters relating to marriage, divorce, inheritance, etc.
key_features: Matters covered: marriage, divorce, maintenance, inheritance

name: Arbitration and Conciliation Act
summary: Consolidates and amends the law relating to domestic arbitration, international commercial arbitration and enforcement of foreign arbitral awards.

name: Right to Information Act
summary: Gives citizens right to access information under control of public authorities.

name: Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA)
summary: Prevents money-laundering and provides for confiscation of property derived from money-laundering.

name: Special Marriage Act
summary: Provides for a special form of marriage irrespective of religion or faith followed by either party.
key_features: Succession governed by Indian Succession Act
